Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Imam Malik Sakhawat Hussain, Al-Mahdi Foundation, 779 Coney Island Avenue, Brooklyn, NY 11218.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Eugene.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by:Imam Malik Sakhawat Hussain.

Council Member Eugene moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meetings of June 12 and June 23, 2008 be adopted as printed by Council Member Liu.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Liu moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of June 12, 2008 and the Recessed Meeting held on June 23, 2008 be adopted as printed.

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
A Local Law to amend the New York city charter in relation to the department of city planning.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Waterfronts
Items.MatterName: City Planning Commission.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the City of New York, in relation exit path markings in high-rise buildings.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Exit path markings in high-rise buildings.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the City of New York, in relation to the installation and upgrade of parking meter technology.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Installation and upgrade of parking meter technology.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the City of New York, in relation to allowing parking at missing or broken meters or muni-meters up to the maximum time permitted in that parking meter zone.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Allowing parking at missing or broken meters or muni-meters up to the maximum time permitted in that parking meter zone.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Metropolitan Transit Authority and the New York City Department of Transportation to coordinate payment technology so that all muni-meter parking cards are compatible with the city’s transit fare technology.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: MTA and the NYC Dept of Transportation to coordinate payment technology so that all muni-meter parking cards are compatible with the city’s transit fare technology.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the City of New York, in relation to creating a public online database regarding violations incurred by businesses that operate delivery bicycles.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Creating a public online database regarding violations incurred by businesses that operate delivery bicycles.

Items.Title: Resolution granting additional real property tax exemptions for certain affordable housing developments.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Granting additional real property tax exemptions for certain affordable housing developments.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the transfer of general vending licenses.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Transfer of general vending licenses.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to renaming one thoroughfare in the Borough of Manhattan, River Terrace, and to amend the official map of the city of New York accordingly.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Parks and Recreation
Items.MatterName: Renaming one thoroughfare in the Borough of Manhattan, River Terrace, and to amend the official map of the city of New York accordingly.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of education and the police department to provide information regarding school discipline and school safety agents to the city council.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: CCRB  to investigate complaints of misconduct by police personnel assigned to public schools.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Housing Authority to review its infrastructure and address a possible correlation between air vents, water pipes and asthma, which may result in an increase in asthma among its residents.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: NYCHA to review its infrastructure and address a possible correlation between air vents, water pipes and asthma, which may result in an increase in asthma among its residents.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon Animal Care and Control of New York City to establish a citywide Trap, Neuter, and Return program for feral animals.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Establish a citywide Trap, Neuter, and Return program for feral animals.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Senate to pass S.4614-A, which would help protect children from sexual predators.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: NYS Senate to pass S.4614-A, which would help protect children from sexual predators.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the City of New York, in relation to requiring instruction and testing on information concerning food allergies as part of the food protection course.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Requiring instruction and testing on information concerning food allergies as part of the food protection course.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring posters with information on food allergy in food service establishments.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Requiring posters with information on food allergies in food service establishments.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Department of Education and the School Construction Authority to implement changes to reform city school planning to better address the problem of overcrowding.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Department of Education and School Construction Authority to implement changes to reform city school planning.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to enact legislation amending the New York State Penal Law to include penalties for police officers prematurely leaving the scene of a crime or shooting without reporting the incident as soon as practicable.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Penal Law to include penalties for police officers prematurely leaving the scene of a crime or shooting without reporting the incident as soon as practicable.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring financial reports for real property acquired by the city through eminent domain.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Requiring financial reports for real property acquired by the city through eminent domain.

Items.Title: Resolution in support of New York State Assembly Bill 4022 an act to amend the public authorities law, the not-for-profit corporation law, the general municipal law and the public authorities law, in relation to eminent domain reform; and creating the “home and property protection act” providing for the creation of a temporary state commission to examine eminent domain laws and make recommendations for further reforms; and making an appropriation therefore; and providing for the expiration of certain provisions.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Eminent domain reform; and creating the “home and property protection act” providing for the creation of a temporary state commission to examine eminent domain laws and make recommendations for further reforms (A.4022).

Items.Title: Resolution in support of New York State Assembly Bill A 9676 an act to amend the eminent domain procedure law, in relation to creating additional requirements before allowing eminent domain for the use of private developers
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Eminent domain procedure law, in relation to creating additional requirements before allowing eminent domain for the use of private developers (A.9676).

Items.Title: Resolution in support of New York State Assembly Bill A 1388 an act to amend the eminent domain procedure law, in relation to requiring new hearings when public projects using eminent domain are altered or amended.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Eminent domain procedure law, in relation to requiring new hearings when public projects using eminent domain are altered or amended (A.1388).

Items.Title: Resolution in support of New York State Assembly Bill A 1265 and New York State Senate companion Bill S 683 which would provide for the creation of a temporary state commission to examine eminent domain laws and to make recommendations for reforms.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Provide for the creation of a temporary state commission to examine eminent domain laws and to make recommendations for reforms (A.1265/S.683).

Items.Title: Resolution in support of New York State Assembly Bill A 1264 and New York State Senate companion Bill S 688 which would amend the public authorities law, the not-for-profit corporation law, the general municipal law and which would reform the use of eminent domain.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Amend the public authorities law, the not-for-profit corporation law, the general municipal law and which would reform the use of eminent domain (A.1264/S.688).

Items.Title: Resolution in support of New York State Senate Bill S 4769 which would amend the public authorities law, in relation to providing cities with a population of one million or more a greater role in the use by public authorities of eminent domain within their borders.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Providing cities with a population of one million or more a greater role in the use by public authorities of eminent domain within their borders (S.4769).

Items.Title: Resolution in support of New York State Assembly Bill A 661-A and New York State Senate companion Bill S 915-A an act to amend the eminent domain procedure law, in relation to the use of eminent domain only for public projects, approval of the use of eminent domain by the governing body when the condemnor is an industrial development agency and the requirement that the condemnor pay relocation costs.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Use of eminent domain only for public projects, approval of the use of eminent domain by the governing body when the condemnor is an industrial development agency and the requirement that the condemnor pay relocation costs (A.661-A/S.915-A).

Items.Title: Resolution calling for a federal investigation into the issuance of an emergency passport to a Serbian national who fled the United States during a pending court case, urging the Serbian government to extradite such fugitive and requesting that the federal government improve procedures regarding access to emergency passports for non-citizens attempting to leave the United States.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Federal investigation into the issuance of an emergency passport to a Serbian national who fled the US during a pending court case, urging the Serbian government to extradite such fugitive.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to placing a cap on the number of misdemeanor and felony cases an attorney can handle in representing indigent defendants.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Placing a cap on the number of misdemeanor and felony cases an attorney can handle in representing indigent defendants.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the Federal Communications Commission to investigate Arbitron's Portable People Meter system and its potential effect on the diversity of radio.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Rights
Items.MatterName: Federal Communications Commission to investigate Arbitron's Personal People Meter system and its potential effect on the diversity of radio.

Items.Title: Resolution urging the New York State Legislature to more clearly and narrowly define “public use, benefit or purpose” in the State Eminent Domain Procedure Law.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: State Legislature to more clearly and narrowly define “public use, benefit or purpose” in the State Eminent Domain Procedure Law.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to providing public notice for senior center closings.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Aging
Items.MatterName: Providing public notice for senior center closings.

Items.Title: Resolution approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Fiscal 2009 Expense Budget.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Disclosing the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Fiscal 2009 Expense Budget.

Items.Title: Application no. 20085436 HAQ, an Urban Development Action Area Project known as Arverne East, located in Community Board 14, Council District no. 31 Borough of Queens.  This matter is subject to Council review and action pursuant to Article 16 of the New York General Municipal Law, at the request of the New York City Department of Housing Preservation and Development, and pursuant to Section 696 of the General Municipal Law for an exemption from real property taxes.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Application be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.

Items.Title: Application  no. C 080178 ZSM  submitted by Park Avenue Hotel Acquisition, LLC pursuant to Sections 197-c and 201 of the New York City Charter for the grant of a special permit pursuant to the following sections of the Zoning Resolution Sections 81-212* and 74-79  to modify the requirements of Section 23-851, Section 23-861, Section 36-62, and Section 81-45 and Section 37-07 and Section 81-277 - to modify the height and setback requirements of Section 81-27to facilitate the development of a 63-story mixed use building on property located at 610 Lexington Avenue (Block 1307, Lots 14 and 59), in a C6-6 District, within the Special Midtown District. This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if appealed to the Council pursuant to §197-d (b)(2) of the Charter or called up by vote of the Council pursuant to §197-d (b)(3) of the Charter
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Application be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, Park Avenue Hotel Acquisition, LLC, Manhattan (C080178ZSM)

Items.MinutesNote: At this point the Speaker (Council Member Quinn) made the following annoucements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Quinn), the Clerk of the Council adjourned to meet again on Thursday, September 4, 2008.

HECTOR L. DIAZ, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of education and the police department to provide information regarding school discipline and school safety agents to the city council.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: CCRB  to investigate complaints of misconduct by police personnel assigned to public schools.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the Federal Communications Commission to investigate Arbitron's Portable People Meter system and its potential effect on the diversity of radio.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Federal Communications Commission to investigate Arbitron's Personal People Meter system and its potential effect on the diversity of radio.

Items.MinutesNote:
At this Meeting, the Speaker (Council Member Quinn) asked for a Moment of Silence in memory of the following individuals:

Army Sgt. Alez Jimenez, 25, of Corona, Queens, 4th Battalion, 31st Infantry Regiment based out of Fort Drum, NY.  He was ambushed in Iraq on May 14, 2007  -- his remains were positively identified in July 2008.

Sgt. Jose E. Ulloa, 23, of Washington Heights, Manhattan, 515th Transportation Company, 28th Transportation Battalion.  He died on August 9, 2008 in Sadr City, Iraq from wounds caused by an improvised explosive device.
